intro: Sahulia suboppositifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sahulia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, narrow, and often hairy leaves. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the wet season. Sahulia suboppositifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
